info.title: Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances API
info.description: The API for management Reserved Instances

get.summary: Cancels the specified Reserved instance listing in the Reserved Instance Marketplace.
get.description: Cancels the specified Reserved instance listing in the Reserved Instance Marketplace.

parameters.name: ReservedInstancesListingId
parameters.description: The ID of the Reserved instance listing.

get.summary: Creates a listing for Amazon EC2 Reserved instances to be sold in the Reserved InstancentttMarketplace.
get.description: Creates a listing for Amazon EC2 Reserved instances to be sold in the Reserved InstancentttMarketplace.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: Unique, case-sensitive identifier you provide to ensure idempotency of yourttttlistings. This helps avoid duplicate listings. For more information, see ttttEnsuring Idempotency.

parameters.name: InstanceCount
parameters.description: The number of instances that are a part of a Reserved instance account to be listedttttin the Reserved Instance Marketplace. This number should be less than or equal to thettttinstance count associated with the Reserved instance ID specified in this call.

parameters.name: PriceSchedules.N
parameters.description: A list specifying the price of the Reserved instance for each monthttttremaining in the Reserved instance term.

parameters.name: ReservedInstancesId
parameters.description: The ID of the active Reserved instance.

get.summary: Describes one or more of the Reserved instances that you purchased.
get.description: Describes one or more of the Reserved instances that you purchased.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request,        and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation.        Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

parameters.name: Filter.N
parameters.description: One or more filters.

parameters.name: OfferingType
parameters.description: The Reserved instance offering type. If you are using tools that predate the 2011-11-01 APItttversion, you only have access to the Medium Utilization Reserved instancetttoffering type.

parameters.name: ReservedInstancesId.N
parameters.description: One or more Reserved instance IDs.

get.summary: Describes your account's Reserved instance listings in the Reserved Instance Marketplace.
get.description: Describes your accounts Reserved instance listings in the Reserved Instance Marketplace.

parameters.name: Filters.N
parameters.description: One or more filters.

parameters.name: ReservedInstancesId
parameters.description: One or more Reserved instance IDs.

parameters.name: ReservedInstancesListingId
parameters.description: One or more Reserved instance Listing IDs.

get.summary: Describes the modifications made to your Reserved instances.
get.description: Describes the modifications made to your Reserved instances.

parameters.name: Filter.N
parameters.description: One or more filters.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: The token to retrieve the next page of results.

parameters.name: ReservedInstancesModificationId.N
parameters.description: IDs for the submitted modification request.

get.summary: Describes Reserved instance offerings that are available for purchase.
get.description: Describes Reserved instance offerings that are available for purchase.

parameters.name: AvailabilityZone
parameters.description: The Availability Zone in which the Reserved instance can be used.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request,        and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation.        Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

parameters.name: Filter.N
parameters.description: One or more filters.

parameters.name: IncludeMarketplace
parameters.description: Include Reserved Instance Marketplace offerings in the response.

parameters.name: InstanceTenancy
parameters.description: The tenancy of the instances covered by the reservation. A Reserved instance with a tenancy      of dedicated is applied to instances that run in a VPC on single-tenant hardware      (i.e., Dedicated instances).

parameters.name: InstanceType
parameters.description: The instance type that the reservation will cover (for example, m1.small). For more information, see Instance Types in the      Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

parameters.name: MaxDuration
parameters.description: The maximum duration (in seconds) to filter when searching for offerings.

parameters.name: MaxInstanceCount
parameters.description: The maximum number of instances to filter when searching for offerings.

parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return for the request in a single page. The remainingtttresults of the initial request can be seen by sending another request with the returnedttttNextToken value. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: MinDuration
parameters.description: The minimum duration (in seconds) to filter when searching for offerings.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: The token to retrieve the next page of results.

parameters.name: OfferingType
parameters.description: The Reserved instance offering type. If you are using tools that predate the 2011-11-01 APItttversion, you only have access to the Medium Utilization Reserved instancetttoffering type.

parameters.name: ProductDescription
parameters.description: The Reserved instance product platform description. Instances that include (Amazon        VPC) in the description are for use with Amazon VPC.

parameters.name: ReservedInstancesOfferingId.N
parameters.description: One or more Reserved instances offering IDs.

get.summary: Modifies the Availability Zone, instance count, instance type, or network platform (EC2-Classic or EC2-VPC) of your Reserved instances.
get.description: Modifies the Availability Zone, instance count, instance type, or network platform (EC2-Classic or EC2-VPC) of your Reserved instances.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive token you provide to ensure idempotency of your modification request. For more information, see    ttEnsuring Idempotency.

parameters.name: ReservedInstancesConfigurationSetItemType.N
parameters.description: The configuration settings for the Reserved instances to modify.

parameters.name: ReservedInstancesId.N
parameters.description: The IDs of the Reserved instances to modify.

get.summary: Purchases a Reserved instance for use with your account.
get.description: Purchases a Reserved instance for use with your account.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request,        and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation.        Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

parameters.name: InstanceCount
parameters.description: The number of Reserved instances to purchase.

parameters.name: LimitPrice
parameters.description: Specified for Reserved Instance Marketplace offerings to limit the total order andttttensure that the Reserved instances are not purchased at unexpected prices.

parameters.name: ReservedInstancesOfferingId
parameters.description: The ID of the Reserved instance offering to purchase.
